result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis Govea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexis Govea is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alexis Govea was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis Govea

records.addlTxt:
1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexis Govea in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM639/22TR2843-2844. DE states he has been unable to hire an attorney. State would object to anymore adjournments for reasons set forth on the record. Court takes a short break to allow the DE and the State to discuss resolution. 

22TR2843-2844: On motion of the State, cases are dismissed.

22CM639: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On motion of the State, count 2 is dismissed. Court orders a $100 fine plus costs and DNA surcharge; bond applied and the remainder is due in 90 days or civil judgement. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample; notice given to def. in court. Appeal rights given.

10:08 AM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Alexis Govea, appeared.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM639/22TR2843-2844. DE went to apply at the SPD Office as ordered per the Court at the last hearing, but DE gained employment and is no longer eligible for SPD appointment. Court finds the DE is not eligible for advocation appointment either for reasons set forth on the record. Court will adjourn to allow the DE to retain an attorney.

22TR2843-2844: TR files continue to trail 22CM639.  Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DE is not eligible for SPD appointment per clerks phone conversation with SPD Office.  Court has reviewed petition for appointment of counsel, which indicates DE has no income although she reported income to SPD.  Court will go over petition with the DE at the next hearing.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
PFAC and Proposed order sent to Br 3

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: PE for APPT of ATTY placed in CRML CLRKs bin
from the Court re: judicial rotation 8/1/22 mailed to DE
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued posted
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia

02:28 PM   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.   Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.   Plea of Not Guilty entered by the Court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am. $300  Cash Bond continued posted w/ additional conditions (see bond entry). mi
and witness list filed by the State
